title: Art + Science: What We See With UV (November 5)
title_display: Art + Science: What We See with UV
short_description: Guided by a conservator, participants will use ultraviolet light to discover the inside stories of artworks and everyday objects.
list_description: Guided by a conservator, participants will use ultraviolet light to discover the inside stories of artworks and everyday objects.
description:
Conservation scientists examine works of art with UV light to look beyond what the human eye can see, detecting hidden process layers and repairs. Join museum conservator Lisa Ackerman for a drop-in learning experience about ultraviolet (UV) light. Participants will use UV light to discover the inside stories of artworks and everyday objects.

This program is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. OISE 1743748.
buy_button_caption: This free, drop-in program is open to all ages.
